text:
Advertisement Survivor of 43 days in Gaza, a Canadian doctor shares inspiring letters on faith, rising from the rubble.
About this Event
Rising from the rubble: Letters on Faith from Gaza - Canadian doctor who survived 43 days in Gaza
Join us for a reviving in-person community event at The Canadian Institute of Islamic Civilization where Dr Ehab Badr, a Palestinian Canadian doctor, will share his harrowing journey of survival in Gaza and Al-Shifaa hospital. Through his powerful message, he will shed light on the strength of faith amidst the ruins. Prepare to be moved as he recounts his 43 days in the heart of Gaza, facing unimaginable challenges. This night promises to be an eye-opening experience, offering a unique perspective on the power of faith in the face of adversity. Don't miss this opportunity to hear firsthand accounts and gain a deeper understanding of the human spirit!
Dr Ehab Bader is a husband, and a father of three kids. He is a professional consultant in leadership and management. He is a physician, and a pediatrician. Ehab graduated from the University of Western Ontario as a specialist in newborns and premature babies in 2014. He is also a graduate of Harvard University in management and leadership. Ehab holds a bachelor degree in Shareâ€™a and Islamic studies from Egypt. He lived in different places around the world, including the Middle East, Europe, and North America, in which he worked in the field of character building, personal and community development for more than 15 years. He is passionate about learning and teaching Islam as a methodology and a way of life. He went to visit his parents in Gaza right before the war broke. He finally was able to safely leave Gaza after 43 days of the war. His father and other family members had been martyred by the IDF indiscriminate bombing of Gaza.
